Dont forget to add our site, as once they join, they can get help from the senior members of the team that can lead them in the right direction. ie bruce, steve, frank, margaret, misty, etc.... I know there is more...  I am just a young buck...
   
  I kind of wonder if we need a bigger site, but if everyone moves to mp3 files, that would help.
   
   
   
  

itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@...> wrote:
          Hi Kay. I think it should be a brief description on how to do all the hacks.

12-469 old
12-469 current
12-470 old
12-820 current
20-125 current

Did I miss any? For a $1 listing fee, and no hassles of buying product in advance then 
having to ship, that would be totally worth it. Unlimited downloads (for how long can you 
list - 9 days?) would reach a heck of a lot more people than selling units at cost. :-)

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psfponies" <psfponies@...> wrote:
>
> opps I mean:
> 
> Can someone send me the written instructions on how to hack the 12-
> 469!!
> 
> Kay
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psfponies" <psfponies@> wrote:
> >
> > I checked to see what it would cost to sell one of ebay. To list 
> it 
> > it is $1.00 for $25.00-449.00 plus 8.75% of the initial $25.00 
> > ($2.19), plus 3.50% of the remaining closing value balance ($25.01 
> > to $1,000.00)
> > 
> > 
> > I would be willing to list the one I have plus give the 
> information 
> > on the free hacking and that fact that you can get one at Radio 
> > Shack for $24.99 just to shut this guy down. At the most I would 
> be 
> > out $1.00 to not sell it!!!! Well worth it I'd say.
> > 
> > Can someone send me the written instructions on how to hack the 12-
> > 249.
> > 
> > Kay
> > 
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wrote:
> > >
> > > Either that, or anyone willing to make them for $25 + shipping 
> > with 
> > > no profit? You could then list them just like the ones that are 
> > > selling...so they pull up identical to the listings that are up 
> > > there. :)
> > > 
> > > LC
> > > 
> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@> 
> > > wrote:
> > > >
> > > > I was thinking if someone would list a FREE DOWNLOAD of 
> > > instructions for the various hacks 
> > > > on the Radio Shack units, it could put an end to the business 
> > for 
> > > sellers that are taking 
> > > > advantage of people who are unaware that they could probably 
> > hack 
> > > the units for 
> > > > themselves. 
> > > > 
> > > > I have seen "downloads" of various things listed before. Why 
> > not 
> > > this?
> > > > 
> > > > Margaret
> > > >
> > >
> >
